1-1-message:
"This is a pre-recorded video.
 ...So I'm afraid I can't answer any questions."

\."Allow me to thank you, truly,
 for taking part in the \C[2]Main Game\C[0]."

\."This is a waiting room prepared for participants...
 The \C[2]Last Supper Room\C[0]."

\."You may fill yourself with food before the game,
 or form a strategy. Use it however you please."

\."Those who successfully beat the Main Game
 can proceed to the next floor! Hooray!"

\."Note that those who do not exit their waiting rooms
 once the Main Game starts will die as a penalty."

\."I will now explain the rules of the Main Game.
 Everyone, please take the \C[2]card\C[0] you obtained
 while exploring and touch it to this screen."
1-1-choice:
What did you do to me?!
Where are the others?!
1-2-message:
"You have your card, yes?
 Now, I will begin to explain."

\."The basic rules are profoundly simple.
 One person will be selected by majority vote,
 and that person will die. That is all."
\."The vote will be split into two parts."

\."Through the first round, the \C[2]preliminary vote\C[0],
 half the total will be chosen as candidates."
\."Currently 11 are alive, so this will be \C[2]5\C[0]."

\."A \C[2]final vote\C[0] will be held using these,
 deciding the ultimate \C[2]victim\C[0]."

\."In short, the victim is decided by gradually
 narrowing it down from 11 people, to 5, to 1!"

\."Of course, even those not chosen as candidates
 will participate in the vote itself!
 Please, do kill of your own volitions!"
\."However, there are holes in this game."
\."We do not care for intentless games of luck."

\."Such worthless acts as using rock-paper-scissors
 to fairly decide the victim are forbidden!"
\."And so, everyone, please take out your cards!"
\."There are four \C[2]roles\C[0] given by the cards."
\."This is a meaningless card with no power at all."

\."And oh my! It's a terrifying role indeed,
 for if chosen as the victim, everyone will perish!"

\."By holy divination, they know who the \C[2]Keymaster\C[0] is.
 A very lucky role! Congratulations to its owner!"

\."Amazingly, this curious card allows the person
 to survive only if chosen as the victim!"

\."Which means if they're not chosen, they die!
 However, there are positives as well!"

\."If they win, they can escape alive
 with a person of their choice!"

\."Well, but in that case... all the others will perish.
 So good luck!"

\."There is one \C[2]Keymaster\C[0], \C[3]Sage\C[0], and \C[10]Sacrifice\C[0] each.
 All the rest are \C[4]Commoners\C[0].
 Committed it to memory, yes?"

\."So at minimum, two people will die.
\! Everyone, do your best not to be one of them!"
\.\C[3]I felt like... I heard something at that moment.
\.\C[3]The loud sound of someone fainting in the room over.
1-3-message:
"There is still time until the Main Game begins.
 Please spend your time freely here."
1-4-message:
"If you wait 10 minutes without leaving,
 you will be killed as penalty. Please hurry."

\.\C[4](Sure enough...
 Maybe I'd be happier not leaving here...)
\C[3]If only it were all a dream...
\.\C[3]When I woke up... mom would make me delicious food...

\.\C[3]I'd talk to dad, and meet Joe and Ryoko
at school like usual...
\.\C[3]And just have an aimless chat...
2-2-message: \.\C[4](How could I have any appetite right now...?)

\.\C[3]In the end, we're being held in
the palms of the kidnappers' hands.
\.\C[3]Our heads can fly off at their single whim.

\.\C[3]There might not be any exit.
We'll just be toyed with and killed
until they're satisfied.
\.\C[4](In that case... then we're just going to...)
\.\C[3]I'd felt death was near again and again.
\.\C[3]Maybe there was no chance left to be afraid.
\.\C[3]Even at this point... I want to keep going.
\.\C[4](Haha... I'm coming to hate my own positivity.)

\.\C[4](I'll do whatever I can...
 If I mess up, everyone will die.)
\.\C[4](This worst of cards... seems to me pushing me on.)

"It's now time. Please head to the grounds
 via the door near the screen, everyone."

1-1-message: \C[3]In front of me were strange desks, about waist-height.
\.\C[3]And yet, we just have to play it.
\."Eheehee... Ah, so you'll take part after all?"

\."Ahaha... Please take a good look
 at those desks, everyone."

\."Eheehee... They are reverse hourglasses.
 Most curious indeed."

\."When these hourglasses have all reached the top,
 the discussion will end."

\."You have 70 minutes until the preliminary vote.
 After that, you can discuss for 20 minutes
 before the final vote."

\."Oh dear... So some would choose
 not to take part in something so enjoyable."
\."H... Hold on!! Kanna... will definitely come!!"

\."Time is limited. That is what she chose,
 and that is the end of the matter."

\."Miss Sara...
 You haven't made the wrong choice, have you?"

\."Well then, let us start the Main Game!
\! Everyone, stand at whichever desk you like!"
\.\C[3]We were urged to head for the desks.
\."Now then, you seem to be prepared!"

\."You are welcomed, Kanna Kizuchi.
 Regrets... can wait until after taking part.
 Eheehee..."

\."Ahaha...! Let this wonderful,
 wonderful Main Game begin!"

1-1-message: Thank you for playing this far.

2-1-message:
Touch a character to review
each person's actions prior to Chapter 2.

1-1-message:
\C[3]There was once a high school student
named Sara who was very cool.

\!\C[3]Walking home with her best friend Joe,
they ran from a scary, scary stalker back home...

\!\C[3]Then she found her mother had collapsed,
her father was gone, and the rooms were a mess...
Sara was disoriented.

\!\C[3]When she came to, she was in an unfamiliar room.
And 10 unfamiliar people appeared before her.

\!\C[3]A policeman who once shot a person, Keiji.
A muscle gorilla of a pro baseball player, Q-taro.

\!\C[3]A weak and loner-ish job-hopper, Sou.
A musician with striking makeup, Reko.

\!\C[3]An awfully dubious teacher, Mishima.
His former student, Nao.

\!\C[3]A strange, aloof homemaker, Kai.
A woofing and mewoing grade-schooler, Gin.

\!\C[3]And a girl who lost her big sister
in the First Trial, Kanna.
\!\C[3]Sara worked with everyone to overcome various trials.

\!\C[3]But she remembered that the homemaker, Kai,
was her stalker.

\!\C[3]And then Mishima died in a practice round
due to someone's vote.
\!\C[3]Sou was hit in the head by someone.

\!\C[3]The suddenly-appearing murderer Alice
confessed to being Reko's brother.
\!\C[3]Even so, they worked together to advance, and...

\!\C[3]Her best friend Joe
and the information-possessing Kai died.
"Kai. How many years's it been since you came here?"

\."Hm... How many indeed...
 Surely, it's been quite a long time."

\."Gahaha! That's why I want to give you this,
 you hard-worker."
\."Go on, go on, try it on."
\."My wife and Sara live safely thanks to you."

\."E... Er... So you mean to state
 your feelings of gratitude...?"
\."Nope. This isn't about gratitude as your employer."
\."That apron... belonged to my own mom."

\."In other words, it proves your initiation
 into the tradition of homemakers!"
\."As well as... your bond with the Chidouin family."

\."My wife thinks the same way.
 She suggested I give you that as a gift, in fact."
\."...S-Surely you jest... Someone such as me..."

\."Gahaha! Your eyes are red!
 Don't tell me you were cryin'?!"
\."...If it comes to it, I'm trusting you with Sara."

\."Someday that girl...
 will learn I'm not her real father."

\."That girl's destiny has so much potential for change
 that I've put my own life on the line...
 It's far from trifling."

\."Because our family's got a hero
 who'll protect her from the shadows."

\."I will remain a shadow, never known...
 and just continue to protect miss Sara."
\."I will use it with care...\.\. I will treasure it...!"

\.\C[10]"I may have trusted her to you...
 But I won't give you my daughter... Never..."

\.\C[4](...When it comes to miss Sara...
 he loses sight of all else, indeed.)

\.\C[4](From this angle as well...
 I must continue to watch over miss Sara.)
\.\C[4](I wonder if she is focusing on her studies now...?)
\."...What, Joe? Face forward, we're in class."

\."I heard they opened as a super good kebab place!
 Let's go there on the way home, I'll treat ya!"

\."Okay, fine!
\! ...You're so loud. Now's not the time to talk."
\."...I get it. I'll bring Ryoko too."

\."Huh, for real?!
\! ...No, that's not what I meant!"
\."Seriously, quiet...!! What are you trying to say?"
\."...Please show me your homework, Madam Sara..."

\."W... We're in class, remember?
 Of course I'm not going to lend it to you."
\."Just for a second!! I'm fast at copying!"

\."Sorry, but I can't. It's called homework.
 Your fault for not doing it at home."
\."I died 'cause you questioned me, you know."
\."And I suffered a long time 'cause of you too, right?"
\."You got anything to say to that?"
\.\C[10]"And this is how it turned out?"

1-1-message: \."...Me and Reko are total strangers now."
\."Perhaps this is Reko's idea of a requiem..."
\."...Ahaha. Miss Reko, how's miss Sara doing?"
\."Tch. Nothing I can do for her..."
\."At least with my song... I wanna save her heart..."
\."You should rest some yourself, miss Reko..."

\."...No thanks. I gotta keep an eye open
 for any more of your bullshit!"
\."...Reko's personality wasn't always what it is now."
\."...You mean she was nice to men?"
\."The opposite. She was harsh even to women."

\."Since Reko was born, she's had talents
 in music and charming others."

\."She was harsh even on herself...
 But especially harsh on incapable, weak people."

\."But Reko was Reko. I could tell in a glance.
\! ...And I'm not talking about appearance."

\."She just has a foul mouth.
 Don't hate her..."

\."She really seems to take it out on me...

1-2-message: \.\C[10]"So cold, man. Aren't we best friends?"
\.\C[3]A sharp pain spread through my body.
\.\C[3]A sharp pain spread through my body.
\."...Yep. Your friendly policeman in the flesh."

\.\C[4](Ow...
 Did I go running around and hurt myself...?)

\."Show me your wounds.
 Heard some pretty loud noises... Something happen?"

\."No need to hide it. You had a \C[2]hallucination\C[0].
 Isn't that right, Sara?"

\."Glad you didn't get any major injuries.
 C'mon, sit down on the bed."

\."This is \C[2]the third floor\C[0]. There's rooms prepared here,
 one for each person. In other words, "get some rest.""

\."Don't mention it.
 ...But I think you should sleep a little longer."

\."Everybody else is resting too.
 No need for you alone to push it."

\."But everyone else is still resting.
 You should rest yourself, Sara."

\."...With how unsteady you're looking,
 you'd just get in the way."

\."Rest for now, Sara.
 Everybody else is sleeping too."

\."You've come this far without a break...
 You at least deserve to sleep."
\."I'll stay in your room, sure. So sleep easy."
\."No way. I can't let you go into danger."

\."...Please move aside...
 I'd rather do that than lie down alone."
\."I'll lend you a shoulder. Rest just a little more."
\."Looks like you managed to rest some."

\."Want to go show your face to everyone?
 They're worried, so..."

2-1-message:
\C[3]As soon as I entered the large, bright space,
I noticed the people there.\|
\."...That is Reko's idea of a requiem."
\."Do not impede her singing, Sara Chidouin."

\."Why're you listening in over by the wall?
 Isn't she your sister?"
\."How annoying! We're strangers now, I tell you!!"
\.\C[4](Right... Reko and Alice were siblings, huh...)

\."Reko... is surely singing with pure feelings
 out of grief for the dead."

\."I don't care to introduce
 unnecessary distraction with my presence."

\."'Course, she's got no mercy for men,
 such as Mr. Policeman here."

\."I think she's pretty kind to you, Sara...
 Compared to how she treats me, at least."
"...I suppose I can interpret that in a good way."

\."Doesn't seem like she gets bashful,
 not even if she's dealing with brawny men."

"Why...!! You truly are detestable!!
 Were you even listening to the question?!"

\."She does seem much bolder than said brother.
 Albeit a little scary..."

\."Kind to the weak, harsh on the strong...
 That's the impression I get."

\."Since Reko's birth, she's brimmed with vitality,
 and had talents in music and charming others."

\."She was harsh even on herself...
 But especially harsh on weak people
 who were all talk and no action."
\."Due to your murder case, I take it...?"
\."...Sorry to make you hear these trifles."
\."Y... You can't push yourself, okay Sara...?!"
\."I... I'm fine. Just... a little exhausted."
\.\C[3]Everyone must be exhausted, body and soul...
\."Other than being brought to Floor 3... Nothin' yet."

\."We were feeling at a loss too,
 so all we could do was rest as instructed..."

\."Nothin' yet. After that awful Main Game,
 we've been off by ourselves resting."

\."We were given rooms for every person, so...
 We carried you here, and have been standing by..."

\."But that bad doll girl's nowhere to be found, woof.
 Should we look for her, meow?"
\."S... Sara... You can rest a little more, okay?"

\."No... I want to do something right now.
 Please, let me go..."
\.\C[10]"Miley... I'm going to deal with you myself..."

\."We should check if this place is safe first.
 Some trap might already be set into motion..."

\."...Yeesh, I was about to say "don't overdo it."
 You sure are quick to get serious, Sara."

\."Alright, sitting around's not my style either.
 Let's take caution exploring the area."

Let's go defeat her

13-1-message:
\.\C[3]Q-taro and Ranger are having a dispute
in the middle of the lobby.
\."Dammit...!! You gotta be screwin' with me!!"
\."Q-taro, what's the matter?"

\."Sara! This Ranger guy just said
 we can't go back to the first and second floors!"
\."I mean, you cleared 'em already, right?"

\."Hold on a second...!
 Kai's laptop is down there!"
\."Who caaares. We'll just confiscate that thing!"
\."Dammit! It was unmistakably a clue...!"

\."That laptop's the last thing
 I wanna let you guys take!!"
\."Keiji..."
\."Bet Q-taro wants to find the truth about Kai."
\."About Kai...?"

\."What a troublesome guy...
 leaving mystery after mystery."
\."I wonder if Kai was a good person after all..."

\."...Some aspects suggested it. His anger for
 the victims, and resistance against the kidnappers..."
\."I wonder if Kai was a bad person after all..."

\."...Some aspects suggested it.
 Like using Nao to attack Sou, y'know."
\."Was Kai acting for good or for evil?"
\."Just whose side was he on...?"

\."...And we ended up making Kai a victim
 without knowing anything about him..."
\."But we can make inferences."
\."Inferences...?"
\."Friend or foe... Let's consider the possibilities."

\."First, Kai confessed to having
 some contact with the kidnappers."
\."So one possibility is that Kai was with the baddies."
\."Like a director of the Death Game, for instance."
\."Yet, Kai drew the \C[2]Sage\C[0] card and died..."

\."In his last moments...
 He said \C[2]he entrusted me his hopes\C[0].
 I can't imagine him as an enemy."

\."Incidentally, Sara... You really didn't have
 any acquaintance with Kai?"
\."Then how about this one?"
\."Something like... Kai betrayed the kidnappers."
\."And he was executed as an example...?"
\."He did sock Miley, after all."
\."Hmm... It's possible he earned their wrath, but..."

\."Maybe that's not it...
\! Then here's the next possibility."

\."Kai was on our side, but had some sort of
 communication with the kidnappers."

\."Though in the same situation as all of us...
\! He did dealings or missions in the shadows."
\."Missions...? Like what?"
\."You remember the \C[2]First Trial\C[0] everyone took, right?"

\."Yes, that game where I was tied to a bed...
 and we had to find the key..."

\."It wasn't the same for everybody.
\! ...Didn't Q-taro say so?"

\."Err... Yes, for Q-taro, the trial was just...
 to carry the box with Miley's head..."
\."Ah...! Is that what you mean by missions?"

\."Yep. In short, Kai might have also been
 entrusted with a different mission."
\."...Like "ensnare the other participants.""

\."In other words, he was being manipulated.
 ...Like a disposable pawn."
\."...There's one more."

\."A very slight possibility,
 but one your friendly policeman'd like to hope for."

\."The possibility we've got an ally
 on the side of the kidnappers."

\."In other words, there's a traitor among 'em,
 trying to destroy the Death Game from the inside."

\."That person was in contact with Kai,
 and had him assist with the plan."
\."Well, Sara? Think that's... out of the question?"
\."One of the kidnappers... is our ally...?!"
"Inconceivable...! Just... unthinkable!"

\."If that were true... Surely Kai would hide
 that he had contact with them!"
\."Because that would reveal it to the enemy...!"

\."Maybe he wanted to live just that badly.
 Or else..."

\."Maybe he thought letting you know
 would work to your advantage, Sara."
\."Wahaha... You've got "I object" written all over you."

\."Reasoning's too tough for me, I guess...
 I'm not much of an intellectual."
"I have no proof that could fully deny it... but...!!"
\."Looks like you can't wrap your head around it."
\."There are clearly some illogical aspects, so..."
\."Well, all that's just my hope, anyhow."

\."Could be interesting if Miley
 was related to this, though. Wahaha..."
\."Keiji."
\."I was just thinking..."

\."There hasn't been a past case
 similar to this Death Game, has there...?"
\."...There has."

\."As a policeman, you don't have any ideas
 about an organization capable of executing
 this Death Game, do you?"
\."...I might."

\."It was decades ago, apparently...
 But I've read the files."

\."There was a battle for influence
 between major crime rings."

\."At the time, the police were putting their all
 into exterminating these organizations."

\."Those living in the shadows had it pretty rough,
 so crime rings started laying waste to their own."

\."But if you're just gonna mutually destroy each other,
 it's better to join hands, they thought..."

\."And so they executed a plan to
 unify the crime rings into one monolith.
 ...In the ways of violence they're so adept at."
\."Don't tell me, that was..."
\."Yes, a Death Game."

\."A mutual slaughter with rules...
 Scary stuff."

\."The representatives had a grand battle,
 and only one person survived."

\."That survivor reigned at the top of criminal society.
 Think it was called the \C[2]Hades Incident\C[0]."
\."Hades Incident..."

\."Shot to the top of the criminal "underworld"...
 Hence, the Hades Incident."
\."But ultimately, the organization collapsed afterward."

\."Justice always prevails.
 ...The police do their job sometimes, right?"

\."Not very, I think.
 ...Since the organization collapsed and all."

\."Besides, Sara.
 You got any connections to the criminal underworld?"
\."Y-You can't be...!"
\."'Course not, right?"

\."It's not good to go tying
 anything and everything together, Sara."

\."'Cause I wasn't asked.
 And I figured it couldn't be very relevant."

\.\C[4](Did he keep it hidden because it was inconvenient?
 Or else, so as not to make us uneasy...?)

\.\C[4](I need to be really forceful with this guy,
 or he's always going to dodge my questions...)
\."You did well."

\."Don't mention it.
\! ...I don't like being treated like a dog."
\."In that case, no treats for you."
\."...If we make it out alive, I might accept some."
\."More importantly, we better get moving."

\."Ranger was mentioning that the rest of
 the attractions have opened up all around here."
\."Is that so...?"
\."Think it'd be good to go look for 'em?"

\."Tell me if I can help out with something.
 This policeman... will be your partner, Sara."
\.\C[4](The attractions... I'll go look around.)

27-6-message:
\."No one wants to taste such bitterness
 early in the morning... No one!!"
\."But... many people drink coffee in the morning..."
\."Um... Please stop fighting."
\."Urgh... Sara Chidouin...!"

\."You've caught me at an unsightly time...
 Well? Will you eat this?"

\."Well, if you'll excuse me...
 You'll receive a penalty if you don't eat it all..."
\."Hey, wait...!! Crying Doll Tia Safalin!!"
\."Do your best."

\."C-Calm down, Sara Chidouin.
 You have a different look about you from yesterday."

\."...I'll be your conversation partner.
 In exchange, you eat the green stuff."
\.\C[4](What an annoying trade...)
\.\C[3]I decided to indulge Alice for a little bit.

\."Hmph... To think bitter melon could be so tasty...
 Seems my taste buds have matured in the Death Game."
\.\C[4](He was probably just knocking it without trying...)
\."How about I call Safalin over to get seconds?"

\."Don't get cocky, Sara Chidouin...
 After this, we must take on attractions.
 Overeating will slow the mind and invite death..."
\.\C[4](He has a point...)

\."But a thoughtful topic to bring up.
 I'm in a good mood now..."

\."So... how has your relationship
 with Reko been since then...?"

\."Hmph... Nothing for you to worry about.
 The status quo is maintained!"

\."But observing her in these past days...
 While at first I thought she had changed..."

\."Her essence has not changed in the least...
 Reko is Reko. The same one I knew."

\."You said that Reko was once
 in the same band as you, Alice."
\."So the reason you disbanded... surely..."
\."Yes... It was due to the crime I committed."
\."...Look at this."

\.\C[3]Alice produced a folded piece of paper
from within his clothes.
\."A magazine article...?"
\."One day, a kind, kind warden handed me this."
\.\C[3]The small article was titled "36-Rai 818 Breakup."

\."\rb[Sa,3]\rb[mu,6-]\rb[rai,Rai] \rb[Ya,8]\rb[i,1]\rb[ba,8]...
 That was your band..."
\."And the reason is clearly written, as well."

\.\C[3]It says... "With one of the members gone, the vocalist
stated "I can't sing this band's songs anymore,"
and the group disbanded."

\."I had thought Reko was a superhuman
 with a will of steel."

\."I finally realized... she was just human too.
 I've never... regretted something more..."
\."This article was my warning."
\."I deeply wounded Reko's heart."

\."And those wounds... can't be healed
 simply by me accepting punishment."
\."But, this article..."

\."...I have no more use for it.
 Throw it away for me."

\."It's not the article I need to confront.
 ...It's Reko herself."
\."Please."
\."Come to think of it, are you talking to Reko?"
\."*hack*!! *cough*!!"

\."...Why intrude on such a subject...?
 How crude are you, Sara Chidouin?!"
\."Don't tell me you've hardly talked at all?"
\."...Yes, but I can observe her at a distance...!"
\."Initially, I did believe that Reko had changed..."

\."But in the past few days, I've found... Reko is Reko.
 Her essence is unchanged from the one I knew..."
\."And there I noticed it..."
\.\C[4](He's making it sound like a good thing...)

\."...Sara Chidouin. Do you even know
 Reko's past in the first place?"
\."Huh? Well..."
\."...Look at this."

\.\C[3]Alice produced a folded piece of paper
from within his clothes.
\."A magazine article...?"
\."One day, a kind, kind warden handed me this."
\.\C[3]The small article was titled "36-Rai 818 Breakup."

\."\rb[Sa,3]\rb[mu,6-]\rb[rai,Rai] \rb[Ya,8]\rb[i,1]\rb[ba,8]...
 was the band Reko used to be in."

\.\C[3]It says... "With one of the members gone, the vocalist
stated "I can't sing this band's songs anymore,"
and the group disbanded."

\."A foolish member caused a scandal...
 And Reko could no longer sing their vocals..."
\."A scandal...?"

\."...A murder.
\! Though for some reason, it wasn't made public..."
\."Don't tell me, the "foolish member"...!!"
\."This article was my warning."
\."I deeply wounded Reko's heart."

\."And those wounds... can't be healed
 simply by me accepting punishment."
\."But, this article..."

\."...I have no more use for it.
 Throw it away for me."

\."It's not the article I need to confront.
 ...It's Reko herself."
\."Please."
\.\C[4](His "warning"...)
\.\C[3]Obtained the Band Breakup Article.
\.\C[4](Okay... Time to continue with attractions.)

27-9-message: \."...Will you really help me collect stars, meow?"
\."Yep. A good policeman's gotta be kind to kids."
\."If you're gonna treat me like a kid, I'll pass, woof!"
39-1-message: \."How strange. It's even night outside these windows..."
78-1-message: \."How strange. It's even night outside these windows..."

2-1-message:
\."It's lighter than I thought.
 Does it hurt, Gin?"

\."It doesn't, but I wanna have
 big sis Sara heal it for me, meow!"
\."Well now... Got me in a sore spot."

\."A wound like this should be fine
 just being washed in water and bandaged."

\."Ah! I have a salve that speeds up cellular repair,
 so if you use that as well, it will more quickly..."
\.\C[3]Safalin cut her own hand, making it bleed.
\."And you use it like so on the bleeding area...!"

\."Proving it with your own body, eh...
 Got it."
2-2-message: \.\C[3]Gin and Keiji are talking in whispers.
\."Is it okay to give big sis Sara this, meow...?"
\."Um... Do you have something for me...?"
\."The thing... big bro Joe had... woof."

\.\C[4](The dog keychain he always kept
 in his breast pocket...)
\."I didn't want the kidnappers to take it, meow..."
\."Is it okay if I take this...?"

\.\C[4](I don't know what he hid from me,
 but I'll pretend I didn't see anything...)

\."It's nothing, meow...
 Don't worry about it, woof..."
\."Well, we've treated Gin, so let's leave."
\."If you get hurt... Please come back again."

\."...Thank you.
 We'll make use of it again."

\."There's no reason to thank her, meow!
 It's 'cause of these guys we're getting hurt, woof!"

\.\C[4](Grr...!
 Who fault does she think it is he got hurt...?!)
\.\C[3]I roared at Safalin with my glance.
\.\C[3]But I was taken aback by Safalin's timid manner.
\.\C[4](Hmm? Reko's glancing at me to call me over...)

Pretend I didn't see

Got it
Thank you
..........
3-4-message: \."Big sis Sara... You look pale, meow..."
3-5-message:
\."You can get used to anything, meow!
 ...Even this room's not bad, woof."

\."If you're having a hard time,
 you should rest here, meow."
3-7-message:
\."Today is the last day.
 In the end, I couldn't get a clue for escape...
 or even Clear Chips..."
5-3-message:
\."If you need something, please just let me know!
 And don't go searching around on your own..."

\."Safalin...! Tell me...!
 What in the world is this?!"
\."*sniff*... Well, um..."
\."We're free to search where we like, surely?"
\."*sniffle*..."
\."Understood... I'll tell you the truth..."
\."What's in there... is a doll."

\."You must have seen them before as well.
 A doll of miss Kanna, a doll of yourself..."

\.\C[4](Come to think of it...
 I do remember using a doll that looked
 just like me in the mirror room.)
\."Do you remember now...?"
\."What's the purpose of these dolls...?"

\."They are... one of the experiments
 done by our organization."
\."I cannot say anything more than that..."
\."Are they really dolls...?"
\."Yes, intricate dolls copying the smallest details."

\."One at a time... taking considerable effort...
 These aren't dolls that can be mass-produced."

\."Who made them...?
 Was it... you, Safalin?"
\."It was... not me."
\."I just keep custody of them."

\.\C[3]The more I looked at the doll,
I felt it might start moving any moment.
\.\C[4](It's like... Joe really is there...)
\."If it pleases you... do you want to borrow it...?"

\."D... Don't be ridiculous!
 Who would... want this thing...!"

\."One of the purposes these dolls were made for...
 is as mental relief."

\."A precious person you can no longer meet...
 You can talk to them, or have them beside you..."

\."A doll... is a doll.
 I don't need it...!"
\."But you're distressed, aren't you?"
\.\C[10]"Please be honest, miss Sara. You need salvation."
\."You have regrets."

\."If you desired it, you could have
 joined hands with Joe and escaped together."

\."You gave that up and killed Joe.
\! And you mourn that fact."
\."Stop it...!!"

\.\C[10]"Facing Joe Tazuna...
 That is your only path toward salvation."
\."That's not...!!"
\."Stubborn, I see... Then just for you..."

\.\C[10]"Allow me to show you a wonderful function
 that will make you feel even closer to this doll..."
"Quit it, you."
\."Isn't that a little too much interference?"

\."Maybe you're not a villain...
 But you're sure not normal."
\."...I apologize... I went too far."

\."I won't speak any more about dolls.
 However, if I may at least offer a suggestion..."
\."I have a device for healing mental wounds."

\."Please... come here before your hallucinations
 become so intense as to destroy your mind."
\."That is all..."
\."...Well, so long."
\."Are you okay?"
\."...I-I'm fine now."
\."*pant*... *pant*... I'm exhausted..."
\."Can't say I'm surprised..."
\."Want to sit down for a bit?"
\."Sara...\.\. did you..."
\."Did you... like Joe?"
\."He was... a close friend..."

\."No one else... was as foolish, softhearted,
 and cheerful as him."
\."Yeah... I'll bet."
\."...I don't know..."

\."But... Ever since he left,
 my heart... has been a mess."
\."...He's just an acquaintance..."

\."So... it doesn't hurt, really...
\! With time, I'll forget... him... so..."
\."...Even if I try to think that... I can't..."

\."...He was someone important to you.
 \.\.Regardless of "liking,"\.\. or "love"...\. right?"
\.\C[4](Come to think of it...)
\."You had someone important to you too, right...?"

\."You said you'd tell me about it
 if we survived the Main Game."

\."It was back when your good old policeman
 was still in grade school."

\."All I had was a single mother.
 We weren't affluent."

\."So when I went to visit friends...
 I had to borrow my mom's errand bicycle."

\."The brakes on it were busted.
 So one day, I fell off, and the bike
 went sailing into the river without me."

\."The embarrassment of being laughed at by my friend,
 and the pain of losing my mom's dear bicycle,
 got me weeping like nobody's business."

\."And there on the scene...
 was the friendly neighborhood policeman."

\."He lept into the river and fished out the bike,
 and even spent hours at the police box repairing it."

\."Soaking wet and awkwardly cool...
 He was my hero."
\."So he... was the person important to you."

\."He's what made me want to be a policeman.
\! I'll never forget it... It's a precious memory."

\."I feel like... I've learned something
 about you for the first time, Keiji."
\."Huh? Oh, really?"
\."...Thank you very much."
\."Don't mention it."

\."Since you became a policeman yourself...
 Did you two reunite?"
\."Well, there's lotsa different police in the world."

\."Okay, that's the end of that story.
 You calmed down a little?"
\."Yes... Thank you very much."
\."See ya. You can always depend on Mr. Policeman."

\.\C[4](At any rate... I've learned the truth
 about the ghost of the medical office.)

\.\C[4](I want to get moving...
 I'll continue clearing attractions.)

5-5-message:
\."It's me, Safalin.
 ...I won't leave my post from now on."
\."Please trust me to care for your minds and bodies."

\."Speaking of which, miss Sara...
 Would you like to forget a bit about
 the hallucinations corroding your mind?"

\."Yes, it would be bad for them to harm your mind.
 ...Please consider it while you can still recover."

\."Miss Sara, will you use this device
 to forget your hallucinations?"

\."Yes! Don't worry...
 It's a very comforting device..."
"Here we are. Attach this to your head..."

\."H-Hey... is this really okay?
 You're attaching all this stuff to my body..."

\."It's all right! Most of these devices are
 for massaging your shoulders while we're at it!"

\."How was it?
 Doesn't your mind feel refreshed?"

\."Ahaha, what is this...?
 It doesn't seem real that I was suffering.
 My mind feels so clear...!!"

\."It's dangerous to use twice, so...
 You shouldn't use it any more."

\."...It's not as if you're fully cured.
 Please be wary of any future hallucinations."
5-6-message:
\."Please make yourself at home.
 Tell me if you have any requests."

\."A-A second time...?
 That is dangerous. I wouldn't recommend it."

\."Understood. Let us trust that your mind
 is strong enough to endure it."

\."P... Please let that be the last of it.
 If used too frequently, it can cause
 great harm to your brain...!"
5-7-message:
\."U... Um... Miss Sara...
 You shouldn't come here so much..."
\.\C[4](I wish she'd at least let me explore.)
\."N-No! A third time is too dangerous!!"

\."Please, Safalin!
 I'm sure... just one more will be fine for me!"
\."Perhaps you've already long since been ruined..."

\.\C[10]"I'm afraid it will ruin your life,
 but if that will save you, miss Sara...
 Let us do it."
\.\C[10]"Please, just do everything I tell you..."

\.\C[10]"And this device will be your reward...
 ...Isn't that nice?"

\.\C[10]"*giggle*...
 Yes, you'll devote your life to me, won't you?"
\.\C[10]"And I'll be sure to make your brain into mush..."
6-1-message: \.\C[3]Something is faintly reflected by the glass.

\.\C[3]It's a hallucination.
I must just be hallucinating again.

\.\C[4](How long can I suffer...?
 How long am I... going to...)

\.\C[3]I approach the closet,
but the hallucination doesn't go away.
\.\C[3]In fact, I can only see it more clearly.
\."Don't go opening doors without asking, please!"

48-7-message: \."Even big sis Nao's not feeling good, meow..."

\."I gotta do something... Why're the only cheerful ones
 the girly murderer and the loner, meow?"

2-1-message:
\."Thank goodness... I knew you was tough, but...
 Y'never know, y'know..."

\."You really suffered...
 Sayin' not to sweat it after that's just insensitive."
\."But lemme say this! You've done nothin' wrong!!"

\."Miley's just a true piece'a crap doll!
 Don't you ever blame yerself, Sara!!"
\."No need fer thanks... I couldn't do nothin'."

\."So Kai... his dying wish...
 I wanna see it through...!!"

\."Yeah...! I wanna get revenge for yer best friend...
 And also..."
\."Kai...! Yer dyin' wish won't be in vain...!!"

\."I'm goin' back to searchin'.
 Wanna find clues, whether it's about an exit
 or about the kidnappers."
\."...That gorilla's... actually a good guy, meow."

\."H... Hey, look! Down the passage to the right,
 and the one in the back..."
\.\C[4](Don't tell me... Sou went ahead alone?)

\."You shouldn't be able to enter
 without a group of two, but..."
"Please, go and check the other areas."

\."Seems pointless to try and stop you.

 Can ya fit through?"

\."T-There's a gap here...?!
 Where does it lead?"
15-3-message: \."Okay, we've made it to the Ruined Corridor."
\."This way! It's through a passage in the back!"
\.\C[4](This is a different passage from the Rubble Room...)
\."Sure is dark... Who knew this was here?"
\."If you go all the way back... it's even darker."
\."Don't let go of me now, Kanna."

\."Being with you like this...
 really feels like I'm with my sister..."
\.\C[3]I didn't know what to say to that.
\.\C[3]I held Kanna's hand as we walked through the dark.
\."Here it is. There's a door right here."
\."It's pitch black. Did you peek inside?"

\."...No. Kanna and Sou...
 both lacked the courage to open it..."

\."I'll go in first...
 If it's not dangerous, you follow."
\.\C[4](Strange... It feels like I've been here before.)
\.\C[3]As I was saying that, I turned around.
\.\C[3]The very first deathtrap I was tested by here.

\.\C[3]If he hadn't made the proper judgement then,
I would have died.

\."Kanna... I'll leave the door open.
 ...Wait outside the room for me."

\.\C[4](This was Kanna and her sister's room,
 where they took that same trial.)
16-1-message: \."Could you come over here and talk to us, Kanna?"
\."There's nothing to talk about, is there?"
\."I don't approve of your flirting, Keiji."

\."Hey, miss Sara. ...On a date with Keiji?
 I don't think this place is all that exciting."
\."I could say the same to you."
\.\C[4](This is far from a friendly mood...!)

\."...Well, I'll get straight to the point.
 We want the laptop back."

\."You heard him.
 What do you think, Kanna?"
\."And you heard her. Give it up, Keiji."

\."I was the first one to find the laptop anyhow.
 Am I obligated to give it "back" to you?"
\."Sou... You don't have the password anyway."
\."Then what's got you so antsy, miss Sara?"
\."What do you intend to do with it?!"

\."Get some useful information, of course.
 The truths that Kai Satou was trying to protect..."
\."What's yours is mine. And what's mine is mine!"

\."What an absurd way of thinking.
 Then again, those are the sort of methods
 you've used to scrape together trust."

\."Aren't you afraid...?
 Afraid of me seeing what's on this laptop."
\."I'm very curious just what you could be hiding."

\."If you're suspecting us,
 I think you're gonna be disappointed."
\."Then let's sit down and check that."
\."Seeing as I did find a charger."

\."If Kanna brought the laptop...
 you would give her that..."

\."Want me to go first, huh...?
 You're surprisingly cautious, Kanna."

\."Your sister held this in her last moments.
 I hope something's left on it..."
\.\C[3]Kanna traded the laptop for the phone.
\.\C[3]She stared, transfixed, at the phone's screen.

\."Your sister held this in her last moments.
 I hope something's left on it..."
\.\C[3]Kanna traded the laptop for the phone.
\."I... love you too...!! I love you...!!"
\.\C[4](Sure enough... she read the changed message.)
\.\C[4](Don't tell me... did Sou write that...?)
\."Got nothing left to say to you guys now, miss Sara."
\."Hold on. You might not, but we sure do."

\."Quit getting into quarrels. We're all in
 the same situation, with collars around our necks."
\."Or else maybe... you don't have a collar?"
\."Ahahaha!\! Wow, you're suspecting me because of that?!"
\."I've changed my mind. Let's do a trade."

\."I'll return the laptop.
\! ...If you give me 50 of your tokens."

\."You should surely have
 most of your own tokens still, Keiji."
\."You can't lie to me and say you don't have enough."

\."This is our chance, Keiji!
 50 tokens hurts, but... You should accept...!"

\."Ahh... Are you afraid of
 someone buying your personal info?"

\."Don't do it, Keiji!
 With 50 tokens, he can buy your personal info!"

\."Don't get me wrong.
 \C[2]If you gave 50 tokens to miss Sara\C[0], that'd do too."

\."With someone as trustworthy as miss Sara,
 even giving 50 tokens should be easy."

\."It's okay. If you give them to me,
 I'll just give them right back."
\."Do it, quickly! Let's get the laptop back!"

\."Well now... I guess that was mean, Keiji.
\! ...I didn't intend to tease you."

\."This trade is over.
 ...Have a nice date."

\."Let's forget about it.
 Right, we need to do attractions..."

\.\C[3]I understand this.
We're all strangers who just met here.
\.\C[3]Even I haven't entrusted my whole mind to Keiji.
\.\C[3]So it's selfish to feel so shocked.

\.\C[4](Is it exhaustion...?
 I didn't realize I fell asleep...)

\.\C[4](I thought I'd cried so much
 that I'd never be able to cry again...)

\.\C[4](But once time passes...
 my strength recovers like nothing ever happened...)
\.\C[3]I can't speak the words "I miss you."
\.\C[3]There's no road but the one forward.

\.\C[4](It's strange...
 Crying yourself asleep lets you forget things.)
\.\C[3]I regained the energy to stand up.

"...What's done is done."

 Why did you hand it over?"

\."Please, tell me your reason.
 Why did you hand it over?"
\."It was..."
\."The allure of escape..."

\."Kanna... no, Sou, her manipulator.
 He's a demon of a man, I tell ya."

\."Kanna learned I was gathering lotsa tokens,

 I handed the laptop over to 'em...!"
\."I... wouldn't be able to look Kai in the eye."
\."...I could say the same thing."

\."Never knowing he was protecting me in the least,
 I lived out my days..."

\."...And before he was able to tell me anything,
 I let him die."

\."There's no point in regret.
 Let's do what we must, Q-taro."

 What of Reko's tokens?"

\! ...And tell me if you seek my observational skills."

18-3-message: \."Big sis Sara, did you collect enough stars, meow?"

\."Then I'll come with you
 for attractions anytime, woof!"
21-1-message: \."...How long's my body been like this...?"
22-1-message: \."Err... there's no need to be afraid."

\."R-Right! I-I'm not afraid at all!
 S-So what did you want to t-talk about...?"

\."Err, yes, well... I wanted to know, um...
 who you've traded tokens with..."

\.\C[4](Alice... He's doing his best to collect
 Reko's tokens...!\! From people other than Reko!)
22-3-message: \."I should... probably buy a prize..."
\."Ah... Sara."
\."Sara, how are you using the tokens you've gotten?"
\."My tokens...?"

\."Yeah, of course... We know nothing about
 the Death Game, so it's best to get more info..."

\."Is that true...?
 I can't think of how to use them either...
 I've been unsure what I should do."

\."Sure enough... We probably need to buy the prizes
 to know more about the Death Game..."

\."Is that true?
 Gin's been doing the same thing..."

\."I have a few, so... I'm wondering if I should
 go to the Prize Exchange for info on the Death Game."
\."Should I buy a prize, I wonder...?"

4-1-message: \.\C[3]Something's been placed on the chair.
\.\C[4](What is this...?)
\.\C[3]Obtained Four Papers.
\.\C[4](These look familiar...!)
\.\C[4](Our names...?!)
\.\C[3]Names, occupations, and mysterious numbers.
\.\C[3]I remember this.
"What is it, meow?"

\."Take a look at this.
 It's a piece of paper I picked up."

"My-my-myow?!
 This looks...!!"
\."This is Gin's."
"Similar, woof! Totally the same, woof!"
\."Look at this. If you remove the left half..."
"And connect it to the piece I have...!"
\."They connected, woof!!"

\."These are the same as the sheet
 Gin showed us in the Main Game...!!"

\.\C[4](And they're not torn up! And it's 4 sheets...!
 Sixteen people's names...)
\.\C[4](...Sixteen?)
\.\C[4](Four names per page...)
\.\C[4](There are... 20 participants in the Death Game...)
\.\C[4](One sheet... is missing?)
\.\C[4](Hm? And what's this...)
\.\C[3]9.5% Keiji Shinogi ... \C[2]Ex-Detective
\.\C[4](Ex... detective...?)
\.\C[4](Has Keiji... left the force?)
\.\C[4](What are these rosters...?)
\.\C[4](Who wrote them? What are they trying to say?)

\.\C[3]I can't be taken in by this.
It might be a trap.
\.\C[4](Settle down...)
\.\C[3]I took a deep breath.
\.\C[3]Once calm, I realized the situation I was in.

\.\C[4](It's not the time to be looking at these!
 Where is everyone...?!)

2-1-message: \.\C[3]As if not minding us at all, he doesn't even move.

\."That's the receptionist doll.
 And this is the Prize Exchange!"
\C[3]Everyone was handed a wallet of some kind.
\.\C[4](Inside are... tokens with my face on them...?)

\."Huh... So let me guess, you can trade these tokens
 for the prizes on display here?"
\."Correct! Just what I expected from you!"

\."The prizes include things related to clearing Floor 3,
 personal information profiles... and more!"
\."You \C[2]cannot trade for prizes\C[0] using \C[2]your own tokens\C[0]."
\."\C[2]You can only use tokens you get from others\C[0]!"

\."And if you get a lot from somebody,
 you can nab that person's personal info."

\."All y'all bastards are gonna be selling, buying,
 stealing, and surrendering those suckers!"
\."In short, it's \C[2]a game of buying and selling trust\C[0]!"
\."How idiotic... There's surely more to this."

\."I've got a good idea. If one of us gathers tokens
 and buys a prize, we can all share the info."

"We could share all our tokens right here
 and share the information we need.
 ...This doesn't qualify as a game."
\."Hyee! Trying to be perfectly fair and just, eh?"

"I'll accept everyone's tokens...!
 Then I'll tell everyone the info from the prizes!"

\."Good plan, Sara!
 If we share our info, this's no game at all!"

\."Waugh, y'all are boring! Some real game-breakers.
 Geez louise..."
\."Well, too bad for you, but that's not all!"

\."All of you will experience
 \C[2]9 attractions\C[0] located around the third floor,
 and earn the right to challenge the Main Game."

\."Whenever you clear an attraction,
 you'll receive \C[2]Clear Chips\C[0]..."

\."And if you don't collect 10 within the time limit,
 you'll die before the Main Game starts!"

\."Mwahaha...! Please do relax, miss Nao!
 Unlike in the Main Game, if you do well,
 then no one will have to die!"

\."Most attractions require a group of two.
 ...However, one cannot do the same attraction twice."

\."\C[2]Tokens\C[0] and \C[2]Clear Chips\C[0]...
 I'm starting to see what you're getting at."
\."Now, get what you need to do?"

\."Use the Me-Tokens you've received however you want.
\! ...Though \C[2]you can only buy stuff with others' tokens\C[0]!"

\."By the way... The more tokens you get, the better.
 There's a grand prize, too..."

\."\C[2]A ticket to the surface\C[0]!
 It's first-come first-serve, so you snooze, you lose!"

\.\C[4](Huh?! I don't see anything like that
 on the counter...!)

\."Your time limit is 3 days!
 Relax! You've got plenty of food and clothes,
 and even time to rest, so sleep soundly!"

\."We won't put any traps or other trickery
 in your personal rooms, so use 'em freely!"

\."Now, let the Sub-Game...
 The \C[2]Trust Barter Game\C[0], begin!"

\.\C[4](But... We have to do it...
 I can't just die...)

2-2-message:

 Please inform me if you have business."
\."What would you like me to answer?"

"I am a receptionist doll here to support you
 in your time living on the third floor.
 I can trade and explain the prizes."

"There are two types of prizes.
 \C[4]Prizes with blue numbers\C[0] and \C[10]prizes with red numbers\C[0]."

\."\C[4]Prizes with blue numbers\C[0] are normal.
 You can trade for them using that number of tokens."

\."\C[10]Prizes with red numbers\C[0] are exclusive.
 You can only trade for them using tokens of
 the person relevant to that prize."

\."For instance, you may only trade for Mr. Keiji's
 personal information using Mr. Keiji's tokens."
"There is nothing of the sort here."

\."I thought it could be a clue to escape...
\! But... I'm too scared... to watch..."
\."Please! Would you watch it with me?!"

\."U-Um, you can close your eyes!

\."Oh, and... If you could stroke my back
 and cheer me on like "you can do it!"...!"
\.\C[4](Can I shut my eyes on such a thing...?)

\.\C[4](But I don't see refusing being an option...
 Nao is just as exhausted as me...)

\."Ahh... Thank you very much...!!
\! I'm sorry about this, Sara..."

\."...Understood.
 I'll close my eyes, hold your hand,
 and furiously stroke your back...!"

\."Thank you so much...!!
\! Um... and please don't forget
 the "you can do it!" chanting either!"

\."Apparently you can view it in the Monitor Room...
 Let's go, Sara...!"

4-1-message:
\.\C[3]A suspicious vending machine
sits at the top of the stairs.
\.\C[4](There aren't any items displayed inside...)
\.\C[4](And no prices shown, either...)
\."Hm? The power's on..."

\."A vending machine with no clear merch or prices...
 The hell's its deal, you think?"
\."The bill acceptor slot is plugged up..."
\."But it looks like you can put in coins."
\."Like tokens...?"

\."...W-What should we do?
 Put in some tokens...?"
\."H... Hold on a second...!"
\."I'll... try putting some in!"
\."C-Cut it out!"
\."You don't gotta take the risk. Move it."
\."...Reko, go ahead."
\."All right, we're doin' it! Here goes..."
\."Step back just in case, Sara."
\."It might be a trap. Just touching it could be bad."

\."Sure, but like...
 Before the others come in and get all curious..."
\."D... Don't do it, Reko...!"
\."In the end... somebody's gotta investigate it!"
\.\C[3]Reko swiftly inserted a token.
\."...Nothin's happening."
\."Maybe... One token isn't enough?"
\."Seeing as there's this number above it, maybe..."
\."You have to insert... 200 tokens?"

\."H-Huhhh?! Who's gonna earn that many?!
\! That'd better be one goddamn tasty soda!"
\."Maybe there's no need to worry about it..."

\."Got a point... 200 is just unreasonable.
 No problem ignoring it, then."

\."Well, ain't that a relief.
 Let's ditch this creepy place."
\."Oh... Reko."

\.\C[3]I took the token she inserted from the return slot,
and gave it back to Reko.

\."Hey, thanks.
 Now let's move, Sara."
\."Right."
\.\C[4](Maybe we can come back if we solve the mystery...)
\.\C[4](Besides, it's about time I do an attraction.)
4-1-choice:
I'll put some in
You put some in
Let's not
4-2-message:
\.\C[3]A suspicious vending machine
sits at the top of the stairs.
5-1-message:
\.\C[3][Room of Lies] Reward: 
Don't be fooled. If entangled by lies, you'll die.

Warning: The bonus will close once someone clears it.
5-2-message: \.\C[3]The door is firmly shut.
6-1-message: \C[3]I can hear the sound of tokens being inserted.
\."D... Don't worry. You got a bad habit of that."

"U-Um...
 I want your help with the attractions."
\."What in the world... is that vending machine?!"

\."Don't get in the way, Sara.
 ...I collected 200 tokens!"

\.\C[3]I can see the number 200
written in blue above the machine.

"You're trying to buy a soda
 from that vending machine, aren't you...!"

\."I'm... gonna investigate the escape route...
 So we can all lead a revolution together!"
\."You value the spirit of fair play, Q-taro."

\."If that were really your intent...
 You would have told me before our trade!!"

\."I'm jus' usin' a right I earned fair and square...
 so I can go outside first!"

\."An' I'm gonna call for help!
 It's a hell of a lot more realistic than
 rebelling against who knows how many kidnappers!"
\."I got no intention of leavin' you guys to die!!"

\."I ain't gonna trouble ya...!
 Please, lemme go, Sara...!!"

\."Sure we are!! That's why...
 I'm leavin' to call for help!!"

\."Then it doesn't have to be you, Q-taro!
 Keiji would be better for mobilizing the police!"
\."See, Q-taro?! You... just want to save yourself!!"

\."...I know that.
 We even overcame our allies' deaths..."

\."Then when we leave, we leave together...
 Right, Q-taro?!"

\."If we pass on this, up next's another Main Game...
 Someone's dyin', with certainty...!!"

\."They'll be killed like Mishima or Joe...!
 Or off 'emselves like Kai!!"

\."This is our chance...!
 A way one of us can definitely return!!"

"Gin is doing his best...!
 A kid, much younger than you, Q-taro...!"

\."And Kanna... she's in middle school...!
 Even so, she's desperately holding on!!"
\."You're not the only one suffering, Q-taro!!"

\."I ain't never stood on the mound
 as a first-stringer..."

\."I gotta prove that even people without parents
 can have dreams, and make 'em come true..."
\."I gotta show that to the kids at the orphanage!!"
"Sorry! Forget to mention a little somethin'!"

\."Yer not gonna say you didn't expect us
 to really get 200, so we can't actually escape...?!"
\."Dumbass. Of course you can really escape."

\."It's real-deal freedom.
 You'll be free from the threat of death."

\."But y'know... I didn't tell you how we'd handle
 the ones who were left."
\."This is what you'd call \C[10]a solitary victory\C[0]."
\."I... I didn't hear nothin' about this!!"

\."I... I already used all those tokens!
 How dare you do this?!"
\."Yeah, guess it's not very fair, huh?"

\."Gotcha! I'll pay 'em back just for you!
 All the tokens you used!"

\."...Great, right? Good for you.
 \C[10]You don't have to kill your allies...\C[0]"
\."Stop now and I'll give the tokens back, okay?"

\.\C[10]"Nooooo... don't tell me!
 You gonna sacrifice them just to save yourseeelf?"

\."We're allies, right?!
 Q-taro... you couldn't do such a thing...!"

\."W... What about Kai's dying wish?!
 Gin and Kanna... have parents waiting for them!"

\."Real-deal freedom... This lying doll is just
 making it all up!! You're being tricked!!"
\.\C[3]Mixed in with it is the faint sound of a door opening.
\.\C[3]Q-taro disappears into the light behind that door.
\.\C[3]Gazing at the light of hope mere meters away...
6-1-choice:
That's my line
Help me with the attractions

Planning to escape alone?!
Trying to buy a soda?!

That's underhanded!
We should all leave together!
Even kids are hanging tough!
8-1-message: \."Just what the hell is that vending machine..."
8-3-message:
\."...No, it's no good!
 I can't do this...!!"
\.\C[4](He's muttering things to himself...)
9-1-message:
"This is a rather gloomy place...
 I'm fond of it."
10-1-message: \C[3]Q-taro is walking around unsteadily.
27-2-message: \.\C[3]"200" is written in blue above the vending machine.
44-1-message: \.\C[3]There's a mysterious switch on the wall.
\."Noticed the switch there?"
\."What is this for...?"
\."Dunno... But there's an interesting note here."
\.\C[3]Above the switch are the words "Bonus Attraction."
\."Bonus Attraction...?"
\."I'll push it."
\."Wha?! You just went and pushed it, Sara?!"
\."This time, it could be a trap."

\."Yeah...
 But "Bonus"... it's curious, right?"

\."If you take it at face value,
 I thought, it might be worth betting on..."
\."Sure, but..."

\."Man, I can't ignore it when it's so intriguing...
 I'm gonna try pushing it."
\."...Don't look so worried, okay?"
\."Step back, Sara."
\.\C[3]Reko pushed the switch.
\.\C[3]With a loud noise, something activated.
\."Sara! A door appeared!!"
\."Is that...?!"

\.\C[3]There's a piece of paper on the door.
It reads...

\.\C[3][Room of Lies] Reward: 
Don't be fooled. If entangled by lies, you'll die.

Warning: The bonus will close once someone clears it.
<<REMOVE>>
\."Room of Lies...?"
\."It's a tenth attraction...!"

\."The hell's going on here?
 Shouldn't there be 9 attractions?"
\."Y... Yes, we heard that, but..."
\."And... 6 Clear Chips...?"
\."It's awfully suspicious, isn't it?"
\."Hey, Sara. Did you check all 9 attractions?"

\."Specifically, how many Clear Chips
 you get from each attraction."

\."Out of the nine attractions, seven give ,
 one gives , and one gives ."
\."And all the attractions gotta be done in pairs."
\."Ah...! Right!"

\."You noticed yet? There's nine of us.
\! ...That's an odd number."

\."A person can't re-enter an attraction
 once they've already cleared it..."

\."So each attraction will always end up
 with one person who can't do it."

\."Even if everyone who can form a pair
 goes around to every attraction..."
\."The number of Clear Chips we can get... is 84."
\."And for 9 of us to win... requires 90...!"

\."So we're short 6.
 At least one person'll die from not having enough..."

\."If we beat this Bonus Attraction,
 it gives us exactly enough...!!"
\."Ain't no logic in avoiding this place, Sara."

\.\C[4](If we hadn't discovered this attraction,
 someone would have died...!)
\."Now it's just... who does it."
\."Of course, I'll do it."
\."B-But Reko...!"
\."And who to pair up with...?"

\."Well, Sou can't be trusted for shit.
\! Gin, Kanna, and Nao... don't wanna put 'em in danger."

\."Q-taro... probably needs compensation to convince.
\! That guy's a realist."
\."What about Keiji...?"
\."No offense, Sara..."

\."But I can't trust that guy...
 He's hiding something."

\."I don't even have to think about it.
 I'll pair with you."
\."...You can't do that, Sara."
\."Why not...?!"
\."...So that leaves Alice, doesn't it?"

\."Nothing could be more awkward...
 But I guess that's what I gotta do."
\."...Incidentally, am I not an option?"
\."...You can't do that, Sara."
\."You're overworking yourself."

\."You've saved our asses again and again.
 And I'm supposed to be older... I'm pathetic..."
\."I want to be equals with you, Sara."
\."It won't satisfy me to just keep getting saved."
\."Equals...?"
\."Then please, don't be modest."

\."You should choose the best option.
 ...If that's not me, then I understand."
\."I'm afraid to just wait around, too..."
\."You sure...? You got the stamina for this?"

\."Lives are on the line... You should go with
 the person you can trust most, Reko."

\."I would do the same thing.
 You don't have to be modest."

\."Got it... Then nuts to modesty.
 Sara... Can ya be my partner?"
\."Of course."

\."Hell yeah, I'm in your debt!
 'Cause really, I couldn't imagine anyone but you!"
\."Let's beat this and come out safe, partner!"

\.\C[3]I grabbed Reko's outstretched hand
and gave her a firm handshake.

\.\C[3]Then, through a gap in Reko's glove,
a liquid trailed onto my hand.
\.\C[3]It was blood.
\.\C[3]That was when I finally noticed.

\.\C[3]Reko had scratches and bruises
in inconspicuous places all over her body.
\.\C[3]...She had been pushing herself.

\.\C[3]No doubt, she challenged the attractions...
to earn Clear Chips for the weaker of us,
like Gin and Nao...

\.\C[3]And surely, there were more wounds
on the thin hands within those gloves...
\."What's up, Sara?"
\."Forget it. Let's go...!"
44-1-choice:
I'll pair with you
That leaves Alice, then

Then don't be modest
Go with the most trustworthy

1-1-message: \."Almost like... some kinda security room, ain't it?"
\.\C[4](Hm? I think I hear a faint sound...)
1-5-message: \."Sara!"
\."Kanna."
\."H... Hey there..."

\."I... I worried you, huh...
 Kanna explained it to me..."

\."It's just one shock after another...
 I couldn't blame anyone for being paralyzed."

\."Um, Sara... It looks like attractions
 have appeared in a few places."
\."Yeah... So I heard."

\."It looks like you can go to
 three more attractions from here, in fact."
\."Look, behind you."
\.\C[4](He's right! There are paths on the opposite side...!)
\.\C[3]Discovered 3 Death Attractions.
\.\C[3]You can select attractions via the Move menu.

\."I wonder... Maybe some locations opened up
 other than the attractions."
\."Let's search for a little longer, Kanna."
1-7-message:
\.\C[3]The two went walking toward the lobby
with an imposing air about them.
1-9-message:
\.\C[3]Nao inserted the victim video
into the machine in front of her.
\.\C[3]I selected the center monitor and hit the play button.

\.\C[3]I said I would close my eyes...
but sure enough, I'm too curious...

\.\C[3]The screen showed a woman in a dim room,
tied up in chains.
\.\C[3]The woman is wearing a suit... no, a uniform.

\.\C[5]"Unless I settle the score with you...
 'Fraid I can't move forward..."
\.\C[3]The chains around the woman's body... tore her apart.

\.\C[3]But,\.\. what disturbed me even more...\.\.
was the man in front of the camera.

\."I want to check something!
 Let's watch it again..."
\."I don't... think I could bear it...!!"

\.\C[4](But... I'm sure of it.
 He looked like Keiji...!)
\."Even though I'm the one who bought the video..."

\."That man we saw from behind...
 Don't you think he looked like someone?"
\."S-Sorry... I didn't pay that much attention..."

\."I just felt so bad for the woman...
 I didn't notice..."
\.\C[4](And I couldn't ask her to watch it again...)

\.\C[4](But... I'm sure of it.
 He looked like Keiji...!)
\."Even though I'm the one who bought the video..."
\.\C[3]How much I'd gotten accustomed to this cruelty.

\.\C[3]Even such a horrifying fate befalling
someone I didn't know wouldn't faze me.
\."I guess I've... really lost it, haven't I...?"
\.\C[3]In Nao's chest, I regained a little composure.

\.\C[4](In that video...
 The policewoman and the man in front...)
\.\C[4](It didn't seem like they had no connection.)

\.\C[4](There's too much to think about...
 My head isn't working.)

\.\C[4](I should get some sleep.
 I need rest...)
\.\C[4](Urgh... My body's steadily getting more tired.)
1-9-choice:
Let's watch it again
Didn't he look like someone?
1-11-message:
\.\sw[324]"Oh my, miss Nao and the others...
 You don't look happy."\sw[325]

\."Come to think of it, just what are these monitors?
 They mentioned AIs, but I don't get it..."
\."Y... You mean it's not just for the ones who died?!"
\."Almost like... some kinda security room, ain't it?"
\.\C[4](Hm? I think I hear a faint sound...)
1-11-choice:
Maybe they're prizes
There are 9 of them, huh
2-1-message: \C[3]I hear a faint sound from this monitor.
\.\sw[324]"My, my... What is this all of a sudden?"\sw[325]
\.\C[3]The man on the monitor... It's unmistakably...
\.\sw[324]"Ohh! Why, if it isn't miss Nao!"\sw[325]

\."It's not... a video...?
 You're talking? To me...?"

\.\sw[324]"Yes, I am looking into your eyes
 and talking with you, miss Nao."\sw[325]

\.\C[3]Yes... It is unthinkable.
After all, Professor Mishima... is dead.

\.\sw[324]"Are the people behind you your friends?
 It's nice to meet you. My name is Mishima."\sw[325]
2-2-message:
\.\sw[324]"I am Kazumi Mishima...
 I teach Japanese and art to high school students."\sw[325]
\.\C[4](What in the world is going on here...?!)

\.\sw[324]"...I've remembered. I am an AI program
 of Kazumi Mishima. An artificial intelligence."\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"...I've remembered. I am an AI program
 of Kazumi Mishima. An artificial intelligence."\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"A video call? What could you mean...?"\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"...I've remembered. I am an AI program
 of Kazumi Mishima. An artificial intelligence."\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"Precisely. I am a replica made from copies of
 Kazumi Mishima's memories and emotions."\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"Everyone, I suppose you met
 with the real Kazumi Mishima?"\sw[325]

\."On the back of this monitor...
 There's a photo of Mishima's face."

\."If that's the truth...
 Are all of these AIs of different people...?"

\.\sw[324]"Mwahaha... What a strange sensation.
 I would love to meet and speak with myself...!"\sw[325]

\."Ahh... The way you talk... everything...
 It's the professor... Like the professor
 is actually here..."
\.\C[4](An AI... of a person who should be dead?)
\.\C[4](Then... Joe? Is there... one of Joe...?)
\."Big sis Sara! What's the matter, meow?!"
\.\C[3]I was intently checking the backs of the monitors.
\.\C[10]What...? There's even a monitor with my photo...
\.\C[10]Yet Joe's is nowhere to be found.

\."Sister... Why aren't you here...?
 I... miss you too..."

\.\sw[342]"Ah, ooh, ahh...! Who was it?!
 Who went and started up the Mishima AI...?!"\sw[343]

\.\sw[342]"I get it...! So then... \C[2]Ranger\C[0]...!
 It was you, wasn't it...?!"\sw[343]

\."Hey, don't get mad!
 Everybody seems pretty pleased, don'tcha think?"
\.\C[3]We turned to the voice behind us.

\."I'm gonna support y'all on this floor!
 Best regaaards!"
\."Ehh? You prefer the ladies, do ya? Ugh, fine."

\."C'mon over here, \C[2]Safalin\C[0]!
 For they have so humbly requested a girl!"

\.\sw[342]"Ah, ooh... *sniffle*...
 But I'm angry at you right now..."\sw[343]
\."Yeesh, it's creepy when they all talk at once!"
\."Just joshin'! You're real cute, so move it already!"

"Good to meet you, everyoneee...
 I am the Vice Floor Master, the Crying Doll,
 \C[2]Tia Safalin\C[0]..."

\."Now this is perfect.
 Let's begin explaining \C[2]the rules\C[0] of Floor 3!"

\."Yep. You bastards are probably hyper on-edge
 after suspecting up a storm in the Main Game, right?"

\."And so! We thought of some wonderful festivities
 to let you reconcile before the next Main Game!"
\."Wait!! We're doin' one again?! A Main Game...?!"

\."Whazza maaatter? My face scare you?
 C'mon, Sara Chidouin!"

\.\C[10]"It feels good, y'know...
 Feels like it's full of the dead's regrets..."

\.\C[10]"The regrets of Joe Tazuna...
 That bottomlessly cheerful, softhearted moron."

\.\C[10]"Sure enough...
 you recognized this thing around my neck?"

\.\C[10]"It feels good, y'know...
 Feels like it's full of the dead's regrets..."

\.\C[10]"The regrets of Kazumi Mishima...
 That hypocrite mistaken as the ideal of a teacher."

\.\C[10]"Sure enough...
 you recognized this thing around my waist?"

\.\C[10]"It feels good, y'know...
 Feels like it's full of the dead's regrets..."

\.\C[10]"The regrets of Kai Satou...
 That foolish man whose rebellion destroyed him."
\."Don't you dare...!! Yer the real fool!!"

\."Then... that skirt, too...
 It must be sister's...!!"
\.\C[10]"You bastards got any right to condemn me?"

\."This topic's donezo!
 Now everybody come see what's past these monitors!"
\.\C[4](Gah...! Why couldn't we say anything back?!)
2-2-choice:
Are you the real Mishima?
Do you remember us?
Is this a video call...?

Isn't that Joe's hairclip?
Isn't that Mishima's necktie?
Isn't that Kai's apron?
2-3-message:
\.\sw[324]"...Do excuse me.
 It seems that's neither here nor there presently."\sw[325]
2-4-message: \."...And then... professor..."
\.\sw[324]"Yes, I see... Is that so?"\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"My, miss Nao. You're looking rather down."\sw[325]
\."...Professor..."

\.\sw[324]"If you are fine with an AI,
 I can gladly talk with you."\sw[325]
\."...Professor... Can we talk a little...?"
2-6-message:
\.\sw[324]"Ah, you are...
 Miss Sara, wasn't it? Nao told me about you."\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"She said you were very brave and kind."\sw[325]

\."That's not true at all...
 Nao is... much stronger."

\.\sw[324]"No, you are doing your very best.
 A best effort is conveyed to those around you,
 bringing about unity."\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"Miss Sara, you are everyone's shining hope."\sw[325]

\."You're exactly right... It makes me blush to hear
 the truth laid bare. Please, tell me more..."

\.\sw[324]"Asking for seconds in a modest tone?
 You're a funny girl, miss Sara."\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"Still, if you have it in your heart to have
 a silly chat, conversation can be a wonderful thing."\sw[325]
\."That's true... Heehee."

\."And Professor Mishima,
 you're a kind, cigar-loving teacher as well."

\.\sw[324]"C-C-Cigar...? A teacher should not smoke!
 Don't make such strange suggestions!"\sw[325]
\."But you really looked like you wanted to smoke..."

\.\sw[324]"My original did...?
 Mmmmmgh... Perhaps our personalities differ..."\sw[325]
\.\C[4](He's begun to deny his own self...)

\."Professor Mishima, err...
 You're an artificial intelligence, right?"

\.\sw[324]"Yes, it seems so.
 I have a memory telling me I am an AI..."\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"Perhaps if I didn't have that memory,
 I would think things like "I'm trapped in a screen!
 Let me out!"... and so on."\sw[325]

\.\C[4](He was... created by the kidnappers, right?
 Yeah, surely...)
\.\C[4](There's a lot I could ask.)

\.\sw[324]"Please, ask me anything.
 I will answer as much as I remember."\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"Is there something you want to ask me?"\sw[325]
\."Professor Mishima, how far back do your memories go?"

\.\sw[324]"I believe I remember becoming a teacher...
 miss Nao's graduation... and all the life I led..."\sw[325]

\."Then what about your memories
 after being brought here, or when you were abducted?"

\.\sw[324]"...I have none. Yes, that's true.
 I'd actually met with you all already, hadn't I?"\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"However, any memory before my abduction,
 I believe I do have."\sw[325]
\.\C[4](Memories from before the abduction, huh...)

\.\sw[324]"Subconsciously, I know that I am an AI,
 and should answer as many questions as I can."\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"Perhaps I am just programmed that way."\sw[325]

\."What do you know about the kidnappers...
 that is, the people who made you?"

\.\sw[324]"Hmm... I know nothing...
 I have absolutely no memories of that sort."\sw[325]
\.\C[4](I guess the kidnappers wouldn't leave us clues.)

\.\C[4](To put that another way... Maybe they're free to
 insert and erase memories at will.)
\.\sw[324]"...Apologies I could not be of more use."\sw[325]
\."Do you know anything about the Death Game?"

\.\sw[324]"Come to think of it, I had just accepted it, but...
 You all are being made to play this Death Game, yes?"\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"This is... an outrageous situation."\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"If only you had some helpful information...
 Myself, I know nothing..."\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"...Apologies I could not be of more use."\sw[325]
\."So, about Nao..."

\.\sw[324]"...My dear student. She visited me to learn art
 even after graduating high school."\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"...She has greatly matured emotionally.
 The more you know of her past,
 the more it brings tears to your eyes..."\sw[325]

\."I think... that's related to the fact
 that you died, Professor Mishima."
\.\sw[324]"It appears... I have made miss Nao suffer greatly."\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"...I must let that happen no more..."\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"Miss Sara, I have a request."\sw[325]
\."What is it?"
\.\sw[324]"No, it's nothing."\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"I still lack the courage to ask..."\sw[325]
\."So, about the original Professor Mishima..."
\.\sw[324]"He's died, hasn't he...?"\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"In such a situation at this,
 I should have protected miss Nao, yet..."\sw[325]
\."...You became a victim in order to protect Nao."
\.\sw[324]"Is that true...?"\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"...No human wants to die."\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"The survival instincts
 that kick in in desperate situations...
 can at times result in demonic actions."\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"I protected miss Nao. But even so,
 I do not know if it is right to commend myself..."\sw[325]
\."Professor Mishima... You were a fine person."
\.\sw[324]"I believe... I just did all I could."\sw[325]

\."You really were like a saint.
 Thinking of others more than yourself..."
\.\sw[324]"...Perhaps I wasn't suited for living."\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"But in truth... I wanted to live,
 and see miss Nao and my other students' growth..."\sw[325]
\.\sw[324]"I'm sure... I had those thoughts."\sw[325]
\."There was no meaning to your death..."

\.\sw[324]"...I'm sorry.
 If I'd had more wisdom or strength,
 perhaps my fate could have changed..."\sw[325]

\.\sw[324]"Miss Sara, none of you can give up.
 Please live, and make it home."\sw[325]
2-6-choice:
That's not true at all
You're exactly right
You're a kind teacher slash smoker

Mishima's memories
About the kidnappers
About the Death Game
About Nao
About the original Mishima
Cancel

You were a fine person
You were like a saint
You died for no reason
2-9-message: \.\C[3]It's broken.
\.\C[3]This time, Professor Mishima's monitor is broken.
\."W... What... is this..."
\."The old guy... he's..."
\."Who would do something so cruel...?"

\."No good... Seems the computer in front
 is just for booting it up."
\."The AI was stored on the monitor itself."
\."Mishima... can't be booted up anymore."
\.\C[4](I won't let them get away with this...)

\."...Sou.
 You did this, didn't you?"

\."Y... You're wrong!
 I would never... do such a thing...!"

\."...Kanna was with him the whole time.
 It wasn't Sou."
\."Always with him...? This late into the night?"

\."It's Kanna's job to watch him, so...
 We slept in the same room..."

\."...I was worried 'cause she wouldn't let me leave.
 Though it ended up giving me an alibi, huh..."
\.\C[4](It wasn't Sou...?)

\."...I'm beat. Never run into a case
 with such an unclear motive behind the crime."
\."Who was the first to discover this?"
\."That'd be this policeman here."
\."It was you, Keiji...?"
\."...What was the situation?"

\."Ahh, well... Couldn't get to sleep,
 so I thought I'd have a chat with Mishima."
\."When I came in... well, it looked just like this."
\."Is that true?"
\."It's a shame. Really is."
\.\C[4](What's this...?)

\.\C[4](Why do I get this sense like...
 Keiji is telling a barefaced lie...?)
\."Has something happened...?"
\."Mya?! Don't come in, woof!!"
\."Pro... fessor...?"
\."Someone... got the better of us again..."

\."Nao...
 Do you have any idea who would have done this...?"
\."You mean... who broke it, don't you..."
\."...I don't know the culprit."
\.\C[4](I don't know what I should say...)
\."Professor Mishima is..."
\."Please... don't look for the culprit."
\."W... What do you mean by that?"
\."Please let me be alone for a little..."
\."Hmm... No clues around that I can see."

\."Meow? No bits of wood on the ground
 like when the other monitor got broken, woof?"
\."Nope, nothing."
\.\C[4](So the evidence was cleaned up this time?)

\."This is one nonsensical incident.
 Would love to solve it right away, but..."

\."We need rest.
 Let's do a detailed investigation tomorrow."
\."Asking Reko and Q-taro can wait 'til tomorrow, too."

\."Mr. Policeman...
 You gotta... find the culprit, meow..."

\.\C[4](We'll find who it was...
 For Nao's sake, especially...)
\.\C[4](...Okay. Let's do this.)
2-9-choice:
Someone did us in
Any idea of the culprit?
..........
4-1-message: \.\C[3]As soon as Kanna noticed me, she averted her eyes.

\.\C[4](I don't think...
 I can talk calmly to Kanna right now.)
\.\C[4](Kanna... was working with Sou.)

\.\C[4](Even if she was just being used...
 Right now, I just can't do it.)
4-2-message: \.\C[3]Kanna won't even look at me.
4-4-message: \."Awful, isn't it..."
9-7-message: \C[3]The monitor screen is cracked...!

"H... Hey!
 Wasn't this totally fine before?!"
\."...Whose monitor is this?"
\.\C[4](What's going on...?!)

\.\C[3]The photo on the back of the monitor
has been ripped off.
\.\C[4](Someone... someone's photo must have been here!)

\.\C[3]I looked around without a moment's delay,
but didn't sense anyone nearby.

\."Ahh... Too bad.
 The photo on the back's been ripped off."

\."Mishima, did you see
 the one who destroyed the monitor...?"

\.\sw[324]"I'm terribly sorry.
 I'm afraid I didn't..."\sw[325]
\."Come to think of it... I haven't seen Sou..."
\."Him again...?! Dammit, what the hell he is after?!"

\."Hmm... Look for attractions, or look for Sou...
 What do you think, Sara?"

\."I want... to stay away from \C[2]her\C[0] for a while.
 Since I still... can't be calm..."
\."...That sounds good."

\."Got it. Sara, you guys look for attractions.
 I'll look for the beanie."
\."I ain't gonna let him pull his shit again...!"
\."Don't be rash, now."
\."I feel like... we can't let him roam free."

\."...That's true. Sure would love to just
 throw some cuffs on him and lock him up."
\."God dammit!! I'm gonna take that guy out!!"
\."C'mon! We'll all search together!"

\."Um... Sorry, I... Please let me
 speak with the professor a little more..."
\."Huh...? R-Right..."
\."Thank you very much..."
9-7-choice:
Look on the back
Check if anyone's nearby

Search for attractions
Search for Sou

\.\C[4](He seems to be in thought...
 I won't disturb him.)
43-2-message:
\."...W-What is it, Sara?!
 Don't stare, go off somewhere else!!"

\."Understand?
 Buying the personal info is the only way..."

\."Just doing a little questioning.
 Feels like I'm doing my day job, huh?"

\.\C[4](What was that? I thought I overheard something
 totally unrelated to the monitor incident...)
43-4-message:
\."Figures...
 The more normal it is, the harder it is to get here."
43-7-message:
\."Tch...! In that case,
 the monitor was destroyed by...!"

\."...Pretty sure of it.
 Which is why I complied with the trade."
\.\C[4](These two are holding a shady tactics meeting...)

\."Seems like this floor's still got
 plenty of hidden areas..."

71-2-message: \C[3]Nao's gaze is fixed on a single point.
71-3-message: \C[3]Nao is talking with her gaze fixed on a single point.
\."So then... professor... While you were gone..."
\.\C[3]It's like my voice isn't reaching her.
\.\C[4](If it were Joe on that screen, then...)
\.\C[4](I'm sure... I'd be rooted to the spot, too.)
\.\C[3]I want to meet him and apologize.
\.\C[3]...I can't help thinking about those things.
\.\C[4](Wondering if... she could have saved Mishima...)

\.\C[4](Given that, bringing Nao back to reality...
 is beyond me...)

\.\C[4](As far as I can see, it's as if
 she's just talking to the real Professor Mishima.)
\.\C[3]Smiling gently and listening to her speak.

\.\C[4](How could you show her a thing like that,
 then bring her back to the reality of the Death Game?)
\.\C[4](I wonder, if it keeps on like this...)

\.\C[3]I don't want to be saddled with the duty
of bringing Nao back to reality.
71-3-choice:
If I were in that situation...
Maybe Nao won't come back...

94-1-message:
\C[3]In front of the monitors is a machine that,
despite its complexity, offers only simple functions.

5-1-message:
"As an Earthling...
 I'm not going to let myself be defeated by an alien."
"A gunman... With my samurai spirit, I'll be on top!"
"I like rabbits, but this battle's a different story!"
5-2-message: "All I can do... is cheer on...!"
8-1-message:
"Our foe's an alien, eh...?
 A real encounter with the unknown."

"Doesn't seem the brightest.
 It doesn't attack often with the 1st and 2nd cards."

"Our enemy must love to save up...
 The only time it attacks is on the 3rd card."
"A cowboy... Is our opponent from a Western?"

"Our enemy seems to wanna charge with Card 1.
 Might not attack us then."

"Our enemy sure loves to charge with Card 1.
 Then attack with Card 2... Just like a gunman."
"And here comes a real uncute rabbit."

"Hard to get on a hold on 'em.
 But seems they attack relatively little with Card 1."

"The enemy either charges or attacks with Card 1.
 After that, it's pretty scattered..."
8-2-message: "There's'n alien!"

"The enemy... ain't attackin' much
 with the 1st and 2nd cards, seems like."

"Seems like the enemy only attacks wit' Card 3.
 Block with Card 3, and we got this!"
"This's one gross, goopy enemy!"

"Feelin' like the enemy doesn't attack much
 with the first card."

"The enemy's always chargin' with Card 1!
 And rarin' to attack on Card 2!"
"A rabbit, eh? Let's cook 'em in a stew!"
"Seems the enemy don't attack much on Card 1."

"Enemy tends to charge on Card 1,
 but it ain't definite. Kinda inconsistent overall."
8-3-message:
"Myah?! An alien, woof! We're gonna
 get our brains modded, meow!"
"It's scary, but it doesn't seem that tough, meow!"
\."Give it your all, meow!!"

"That alien only attacks with Card 3, woof!
 Guess you've won if you block with Card 3, meow?"
\."Give it your all, meow!!"

"A slimy guy, meow! Keep your distance
 and don't touch it, woof!"

"...I'm just a little curious
 what that thing feels like, meow."
\."Give it your all, meow!!"

"The slime man always tries to charge with Card 1
 and attack with Card 2, woof! ...Maybe."
\."Give it your all, meow!!"
"I... It's a bunny, woof... Scary bunny, meow..."

"I'm scared, woof...
 I'll give you carrots, okay? Just leave, meow..."
\."Give it your all, meow!!"

"That thing... tends to charge on Card 1, meow...
 I'm scaaared..."
\."Give it your all, meow!!"
25-1-message: \."We'll start with me...!"
\."I'll be keeping watch."
\."Go get 'em, Sara!"

\."Meow! Good luck, big sis Sara!
 I'm rooting for you, woof!!"
Charge Card Battle ~Rules~

\.Select a set of three cards to do battle with
from among four types.

\.\C[4]Charge\C[0] .... Charges 1 energy.
\C[2]Beam\C[0] ...... Expends 1 energy to attack.
\C[6]Special\C[0] ... Expends 3 energy for a strong attack.
\C[3]Block\C[0] ..... Completely blocks attack.

\.If they pick \C[4]Charge\C[0] and you pick \C[2]Beam\C[0], it's a hit!
But you need to \C[4]Charge\C[0] in order to attack!

...That's the gist of the game.

\.Note that in the case of \C[2]Beam\C[0] versus \C[6]Special\C[0],
\C[6]Special\C[0] pierces through and wins.

\.Touching your ally's icon will give you
advice and the like, so... Good luck.

Hear it again
Just try it

\.\C[10]"You realized yet? Your day to day lives

\."Do your best not to die, Sara Chidouin!"

\."Let's announce the results!

 of buying and selling tokens, right?"
\."The number of tokens we've gotten by trading...?"

\."Specifically, we're counting up the totals of
 \C[2]other people's tokens you touched at least once\C[0]."

\."That means even \C[2]tokens you lost after getting 'em\C[0]
 count toward the total."
\."...So we don't have to have them currently?"

 switched out "trust" for "tokens," yeah?"
\."The amount you were handed... That's what matters."

\."So naturally, however many of your own tokens you got,
 they wooon't be counted!"
\."Now to announce the standings! Line up!"

\."The superb person who earned the most trust
 will be awarded a special privilege!"

\."Let's get to it!
 The glorious title of first place goes to...!"

\."Ahem! Well then, let's see...
 Can I have an interview?"

\."What a spoilsport! I'll explain that later."

\."Sounds like the reaction of a guy

\."Onto the smack dab in the middle!
